member.name: WS_SERVICE_ENDPOINT
member.summary: Represents an individual endpoint on a service host. The properties on the endpoint are used to specify the address, binding and contract.

member.name: WS_SERVICE_ENDPOINT.address
member.summary: The URL address on which the endpoint is going to listen.

member.name: WS_SERVICE_ENDPOINT.channelType
member.summary: The being hosted by the endpoint.

member.name: WS_SERVICE_ENDPOINT.securityDescription
member.summary: A description of the security required for this channel. This can be NULL if no security is required.

member.name: WS_SERVICE_ENDPOINT.authorizationCallback
member.summary: Authorization callback for the service endpoint.

member.name: WS_SERVICE_ENDPOINT.properties
member.summary: An array of properties to configure the service endpoint.

member.name: WS_SERVICE_ENDPOINT.propertyCount
member.summary: Number of elements in the WS_SERVICE_ENDPOINT_PROPERTY array.

summary.code: Channel properties associated with the endpoint. An application should be careful in modifying default values. For example, modifying send/receive timeouts may result in unexpected behavior and cause the client to fail.
